page.title: 03The South Downs Way
page.content: The Southdowns Way,a wide downland track,goes through the bottom left hand corner of our squares. There are a lot of other footpaths in our area of the Downs.One from Lewes,which goes up to Blackcap,which is a high hill on the South Downs west of Lewes.There are also a lot of other tracks and footpaths going off the South Downs Way,but rejoining it again later. The proper South Downs Way in our area is shaped like the figure seven. The South Downs Way is 82 miles long stretching from Eastbourne to a little village near Petersfield called Buriton.Soon it is going to be extended by 20 miles. There is an organisation in Lewes called the Lewes Footpaths Group.They walk 5 miles of the South Downs Way every 3 or 4 weeks on Sunday mornings. Their job involves clearing footpaths
